revised_title: Proton NMR Spectroscopy of Protein Structures in Solution
tldr: This article discusses the challenges and methods of assigning proton nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectra to specific amino acids in proteins. The authors focus on techniques to improve resolution, such as increasing magnetic field strength, using difference spectroscopy, and reducing the number of observed resonances through chemical modifications. They demonstrate these methods on the protein lysozyme, which has a well-known structure for comparison.
